author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Peer Group Interaction Method in Language - English and Tamil - was launched for the third batch of students of Panchayat Union Primary School, Pallikuppam, Madhanur block on Friday.

In this method, which is being implemented with guidance of District Institute of Education and Training (DIET), Ranipet, 25 students of class V will get The Hindu Young World supplement every Friday for 20 weeks.

They will also get English and Tamil dictionaries, according to a press release.

The objective of the programme was to improve the students' dictionary using skill, reading and writing skills, enable students to seek new English words, use newspaper as learning tool and develop cooperation among students.

Sivanandham, district elementary educational officer, inaugurated the programme on the occasion. The school's headmaster K. Sekar said the students were excited and interested to read the supplement. They also looked up for meaning of new words.

He also explained the features of a smart classroom that was implemented about five months ago with sponsor from a private trust.

On the occasion, the students displayed their skills through a speech on agriculture, recital of Thirukkural, States and capitals, computer operation and song and dance, the release said.
